result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan S Mottet was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Credit for 26 days, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution of $809.55 plus surcharges to be paid as a Condition of probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Court costs and DNA also to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with Woodman's listed in the complaint.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - 30 days STAYED; to be used at Agent's discretion as well as to huber or straight time.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ryan S Mottet in court, in custody, with attorney William Joseph Reddin.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count 1 and strike the repeater allegation. Court 2 is dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 26 days), if revoked consecutive
  -  1 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  1 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

 TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEAR(S) concurrent

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:   
*Absolute Sobriety  
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No contact with:  the Woodmans listed in the complaint
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 
RESTITUTION:  $809.55 (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);

DRGOD $10.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

COURT COSTS:  $263.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 30 days, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
filed, to be produced from Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility
